question_text: A team uses snapshots to revert VM states during development. Which limitation should they consider when relying on this approach?
answer_options: Snapshots permanently erase previous VM configurations
Snapshots can consume significant disk space over time
Snapshots prevent the use of cross-platform virtualization
correct_answer: Snapshots can consume significant disk space over time
explanation: Frequent snapshots accumulate VM state data, which grows disk usage substantially if not pruned.
